name: Serval and The Formula
statement: You are given two positive integers $$$x$$$ and $$$y$$$ ($$$1\le x, y\le 10^9$$$). Find a non-negative integer $$$k\le 10^{18}$$$, such that $$$(x+k) + (y+k) = (x+k)\oplus (y+k)$$$ holds$$$^{\text{∗}}$$$, or determine that such an integer does not exist. $$$^{\text{∗}}$$$$$$\oplus$$$ denotes the bitwise XOR operation .
inputFormat: Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 10^4$$$). The description of the test cases follows. The only line of each test case contains two integers $$$x$$$ and $$$y$$$ ($$$1\le x, y\le 10^9$$$) — the given integers.
outputFormat: For each test case, output a single integer $$$k$$$ ($$$0\le k\le 10^{18}$$$) — the integer you found. Print $$$-1$$$ if it is impossible to find such an integer. If there are multiple answers, you may print any of them.
